newsitem.title: POLAND: BAUMA APPROVES SHARES ISSUE FOR TWO US FUNDS.
newsitem.headline: BAUMA APPROVES SHARES ISSUE FOR TWO US FUNDS.

text.p: Shareholders of Polish construction materials maker Bauma SA have approved an issue of 430,000 common shares to two U.S. investment funds, Nowa Europa daily said on Saturday.
It said the shares would be offered to Polish-American Enterprise Fund 1 and the Polish-American Enterprise Fund 2, which would be medium-term financial investors.

"These shareholders should guarantee financial stability for the firm. Their investment perspective is not two months but two to three years," the paper quoted Bauma president Andrzej Kozlowski as saying.

Bauma, which seeks to enter the parallel market of the Warsaw bourse, has another 130,421 shares approved for public trade and another 1.2 million registered shares held by its founders not yet approved for trade.

In 1995 the company netted 418,000 zlotys on sales of 15.4 million zlotys. It expects profits to rise to 1.5 million zlotys on sales of 14 million in 1996 and to 2.1 million zlotys on sales of 19.6 million in 1997.
